response:
Urgent high-resolution imaging is needed to confirm the presence, exact location and nature of the pontine lesion and to distinguish infarct, demyelination, haemorrhage or tumour, which determines acute treatment. Vascular imaging assesses vertebrobasilar stenosis or dissection. CSF analysis and evoked potentials help diagnose multiple sclerosis or other inflammatory processes. Routine blood tests look for vascular risk factors, metabolic or infectious mimics and provide a baseline before antithrombotic or immunosuppressive therapy. Cardiac tests are required if an ischaemic stroke is confirmed to search for an embolic source.
